titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Washington City records 1895-1905
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Washington City records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Washington City was a group of clergymen who met regularly for mutual fellowship. At the meetings, the members heard papers read and held discussions on a variety of topics. The Association was formed sometime before 1895.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes and membership records, 1895-1905, of the Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Washington City. Minutes record the association's routine business and list reports delivered to the association and papers read at meetings. The minutes also include copies of communications received from other organizations and a printed copy of the Association's constitution.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
